item.title: My Precious
item.description: This post is used to record some interesting or wonderful things I read or found. Books 2019 《达芬奇密码》, $[$美$]$ 丹·布朗 《带一本书去巴黎》, 林达 《了不起的盖茨比》, $[$美$]$ 菲茨杰拉德 《复杂》 (Complexity: A Guided Tour) 梅拉妮•米歇尔 (Melanie Mitchell) 《德意志之鹰：纹章中的德国史》, 林纯洁 《存在主义咖啡馆：自由、存在和杏子鸡尾酒》 (At the Existentialist Café: Freedom, Being, and Apricot Cocktails), $[$英$]$ 莎拉·贝克韦尔 (Sarah Bakewell) Websites CAS: Cloud Appreciation Society Internet Archive: A non-profit library of free books, movies, software, music, websites, and more.

item.title: Setting MathJax
item.description: To write math expressions in Hugo, a popular method is using MathJax. This blog gives a quick and simple solution. First, write a script. I will copy the script as follow: <script type="text/javascript" async src="https://cdnjs.cloudflare.com/ajax/libs/mathjax/2.7.1/MathJax.js?config=TeX-AMS-MML_HTMLorMML"> MathJax.Hub.Config({ tex2jax: { inlineMath: [['$','$'], ['\\(','\\)']], displayMath: [['$$','$$'], ['\[','\]']], processEscapes: true, processEnvironments: true, skipTags: ['script', 'noscript', 'style', 'textarea', 'pre'], TeX: { equationNumbers: { autoNumber: "AMS" }, extensions: ["AMSmath.js", "AMSsymbols.js"] } } }); MathJax.Hub.Queue(function() { // Fix <code> tags after MathJax finishes running.

item.title: CV
item.description: Research interests Computer vision and machine learning Publications Shijian Xu, Wenzhong Li, Xiao Zhang, Songcheng Gao, Tong Zhan, Yongzhu Zhao, Wei-wei Zhu, Tianzi Sun, Predicting Smartphone App Usage with Recurrent Neural Networks, in the 13th International Conference on Wireless Algorithms, Systems, and Applications (WASA 2018), Tianjin, China, June 20-22, 2018. paper Awards & Honors 2017   Third Prize of Elite Program Scholarship 2017   Honorable Mention for MCM 2017 2016   Third Prize of People’s Scholarship 2015   Second Prize of People’s Scholarship Misc.

item.title: About
item.description: My Chinese name is 徐世坚. Currently, I am a first-year Ph.D. student in Computer Science at City University of Hong Kong. I received my B.Sc. degree in Computer Science and Technology in 2018 from Nanjing University (Elite Program).
